author: santteegt
content: Hello everyone. I'm joining the upcoming cohort as a permissionless participant. My aim is to get a deep dive into the protocol, get used to the codebase, toolings, etc, also document my journey and why not end up contributing something through a coding project. I've seen some of the resources listed on suggested reading within the cohort repo and I'm still wondering what would be the best way of getting onboarded into core development. Should I go straight to yellow paper, there's a beige paper (might be outdated compared to the latter). I also found this course https://ethereumstudymaster.com/courses/ethereum-2-0-studymaster-program/. Do you find it relevant?

author: santteegt
content: Or another approach would be to start focusing on a specific project/idea and start doing a deep research from there
